title: (x) Krug typeface? / Tuscan - probably custom, various suggestions {Reed R, Nick Curtis}
content:
Hi, has anybody ever seen a similar typeface - or in fact the original type - that was used to write KRUG? I believe must be a French or possibly a German typeface from the mid-19th century.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Krug-logo.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20100331220900/http:/typophile.com/files/Krug-logo.jpg) | 36.96 KB |
author: M Dash

comments.content: This is Tuscan ornamental lettering. The closest match I could find on MyFonts is [Miss Scarlett](http://web.archive.org/web/20100331220900/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/fontmesa/miss-scarlett/?testdrive=custom%3D0%26dock%3Dfalse%26size%3D146%26w%3D600%26src%3Dcustom%26text%3DKRUG%26fg%3D000000%26bg%3Dffffff%26goodies%3D%26seed%3D30).
More specifically, the style is known as English Tuscan, most likely French, most likely 1860-1880...
Hi, thank you! This has been really helpful! I'm going to investigate Tuscan lettering now.
